required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Study of IBI310 in Combination With IBI308 Compared to High-Dose Interferon In Patients With Acral Melanoma That Has Been Removed by Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Open-label, Multicenter Study, IBI310 in Combination With IBI308 and IBI308 Compared to High-Dose Interferon In Patients With Acral Melanoma That Has Been Removed by Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: This is a phase III randomized, control, multi-center study of recombinant humanized anti-PD-1 mAb in combination with CTLA4 mAb for injection compared to high-Dose interferon in patients with acral melanoma that has been removed by surgery.

primary_outcome.description: to evaluate the Recurrence free survival (RFS) of the patients with acral melanoma treated by IBI310 in Combination With IBI308 and high-Dose interferon

secondary_outcome.description: to evaluate the Overall survival (OS) of the patients with acral melanoma treated by IBI310 in Combination With IBI308 and high-Dose interferon

clinical_study.condition: Acral Melanoma That Has Been Removed by Surgery

arm_group.description: Participants will be treated with IBI310 in combination with IBI308
Participants will be treated with IBI308
Participants will be treated with recombinant interferon a-2B

intervention.description: In this group, subjects will be given IBI310 3mg/kg IV Q3W in combination with IBI308 200mg IV Q3W for 4 cycles, then follow up a maintenance therapy performed with IBI310 3mg/kg IV Q12W in combination with IBI308 200mg IV Q3W until disease progression or loss of clinical benefit.
In this group, subjects will be given IBI308 200mg IV Q3W until disease progression or loss of clinical benefit

In this group, subjects will be given 15*10^9 U/m2/d recombinant interferon a-2B intravenously on days 1-5 weekly for 4 weeks.Then 9*10^9 U/m2/d recombinant interferon a-2B intravenously three times weekly for 48 weeks
